title: First Street Protests
description: Marjane, at age 9, watches crowds clash with police in Tehran’s streets—her first brush with revolution.

title: Islamic Republic Established
description: The Shah falls; Ayatollah Khomeini returns. Iran transforms overnight—freedom for some, strict new rules for others.

title: Iran–Iraq War Begins
description: Bombs rain on Tehran; Marjane’s city goes from protest to siege—blackouts, air-raid drills, loss.

title: Veil Enforcement
description: Girls must now wear the veil in school—Marjane bristles at forced piety, sparking her first feminist spark.

title: Punk & Rebellion in Tehran
description: Underground punk bands pour into basements—Marjane finds new ways to rebel musically.

title: Sent to Austria
description: To keep her safe, Marjane’s parents ship her off to Vienna—culture shock and loneliness ahead.

title: Exile & Identity Crisis
description: Alone in Europe, Marjane struggles with identity—does she belong to two worlds or none?

title: Return & Reflection
description: Back in Iran as an adult, Marjane confronts her past—how do you reconcile who you were with who you’ve become?
